entry.content:
900MHz

語言、文字、符號，人類溝通的媒介，如何突破七段顯示器的框架傳遞訊息？
在一字一句都需要計價的傳訊時代，訊息內容不斷精煉演化，從數字延伸到英文字母，又或者延伸至以讀音的諧音傳達訊息，甚至當語言、文字無法表達時，改以表情符號、圖文示意。 BB Call的年代，我們以900MHz頻率聯繫彼此，創造出特有的傳訊文化。如今溝通工具已大幅減低人們傳訊的門檻，傳訊文化似乎並未隨之消逝，隱藏在我們已習以為常的溝通中。

Do you remember the days of the pager?

This 900MHz device let us stay connected to each other. The numbers on the screen not only conveyed simple messages, but also created a unique communication culture.Todays, staying in touch is easier, but no longer precious. We hope to bring you back to the 1990s, inviting you to relive the warmth of those numeric messages.

As the digits flash on the screen, you’re invited to experience the joy of hidden codes and feel the emotion behind each message once again.

entry.content:
作品以「烏日故事《茄苳樹下的一場戲》」為基礎，使用擴增實境技術(Augmented Reality，AR)來重述故 事內容。虛擬的樹藏在尚未發芽的種子裡，訴說著一個個微縮故事，並且被人們在生命故事中賦予一位角 色，成為他們口中的傳說。透過 AR，我們將一窺每顆茄苳樹種子裡的未來，也許茁壯成樹，蔭罩大地;也許 與人共舞，與陽相擁;也許孤老終身，見證光陰，無論如何，故事仍持續著......。

「種子裡有顆虛擬的樹｜Virtual Tree in the Seed」為五個畫箱放於展台上方，每個畫箱上將有一顆茄苳樹種子與一張關於文本片段的插畫，當觀眾透過 AR 軟體觀看時，能看見每顆種子茁壯成樹的樣子，並且各自述說著一段故事情境。

< 台南 鹽水月之美術館典藏 >

此時，人們正經歷海平面每年上升3到4毫米的階段，隨著氣候變遷將遽增為每年4到9毫米。海平面的上升並非只是土地的消逝，更影響到人與環境的共處關係。《浮海》這件作品試圖放大人為干涉環境所造成的劇烈連鎖狀態，透過「蛇擺」曳引的視覺效果去重現人與自然時而「同步」時而「混沌」的牽制狀態，進而思考兩者間該如何共處，又該如何面對未來的異變。

Currently, sea levels rise annually at 3 to 4 millimeters, with predictions of an acceleration to 4 to 9 millimeters per year due to climate change. Beyond land loss, these rising sea levels significantly affect the human-environment relationship. “Pulsation Sea” magnifies the profound chain reactions resulting from human environmental interventions. Through a “Pendulum Wave” visual effect, it portrays the dynamic connection between humans and nature, oscillating between “synchronization” and “chaos”, stimulating reflection on coexistence and facing future uncertainties.


展覽：2024 台南 月津港燈節-通往銀河的便利指南

entry.title: 數位循環｜Mass Cycles
entry.summary: 現實環境正不斷轉換為資訊，使人們試圖去尋找能證明「資訊」存在的方法，當我們所認為虛擬的事物確實存在著，環境的變遷、水文的循環將因數位化而改變，數據統計、數位化保存等亦改變了人們認知的自然，我們所認為的真實漸漸從虛擬中得知，使現實蒸發為虛擬又凝結為真實。然而數位與虛擬納為自然的循環中，我們喪失了何物？在一次次數位的循環後又將遺忘哪些本質的意義？數位循環｜ The transformation…
entry.content:
< 2024 新北市美展 - 金獎 >

現實環境正不斷轉換為資訊，使人們試圖去尋找能證明「資訊」存在的方法，當我們所認為虛擬的事物確實存在著，環境的變遷、水文的循環將因數位化而改變，數據統計、數位化保存等亦改變了人們認知的自然，我們所認為的真實漸漸從虛擬中得知，使現實蒸發為虛擬又凝結為真實。然而數位與虛擬納為自然的循環中，我們喪失了何物？在一次次數位的循環後又將遺忘哪些本質的意義？數位循環｜

The transformation of our physical environment into information makes people seek ways to validate "information's" existence. As what we perceive as virtual elements indeed exists, shift natural cycles through digitization, altering our grasp of the natural world. Reality unfolds from the virtual, evaporating into the digital and solidifying back into reality. Amidst this digital-virtual cycle, what's lost? Which essential meanings fade after repeated digital shifts?

「數位循環」嘗試將虛擬地景介入現實環境當中，藉此捕捉數位循環中所喪失的「資訊的重量」。透過實地掃描自然景觀後，運用點雲技術複製出虛擬地景，計算其資訊位元的重量並與現實地景想比對，最後將消逝的重量透過霧化裝置噴出等重量的水霧消散至空間中，正如那些數位化後所蒸發至無的現實樣貌，龐大且充斥在周遭，正在消逝卻無人察覺。

"Mess Cycle" introduces virtual landscapes to physical environments, capturing lost "information weight." Scanning natural scenes and recreating virtual ones using point cloud tech, we calculate their informational weight and compare with real surroundings. The vanishing weight disperses through misting, paralleling the evaporation of digitized realities. Imperceptible yet vast, these shifts engulf us, fading away undetected.

entry.title: Time Organ
entry.content:
< 2024 法國 LAVAL VIRTUAL RECTO VRso VR競賽 優選 >

Time Orgon

Since the changes from sunrise to sunset, humans have continuously explored their relationship with time. With technological advancements, people have employed tools to segment time into measurable units, constantly seeking the most precise frequencies in nature for more accurate time calculations. The development of technology has introduced the "attosecond," a time unit with eighteen decimal places. However, even when finely divided, this increasingly precise time is challenging to perceive. In fact, at the moment time is calculated and quantified, the essential nature of "time as continuous change" is already eradicated. Our body's perception of time should be immeasurable, but the quantitative thought patterns ingrained in us by seemingly objective and precise scientific time have gradually led to the loss of our most direct bodily sensations. This has rendered the relationship between time and bodily experience insensate.

In our relentless pursuit of temporal precision, we have unintentionally neglected our own body's inherent rhythm. The Time Organ art project delves into the "insensitivity" of human somatosensory time, seeking to revive the awareness of bodily time through innate human synchronization and sensory extension. Drawing inspiration from the historical "mechanical water clock," an instrument through which humans initially exercised control over time, the Time Organ artwork employs water as a medium and embodies the concept of extending a human organ. The objective is to fashion a tool that reconnects human time perception with the frequency intrinsic to their bodies. Through the orchestrated chaos and synchronous experiences within the artwork, we consistently prompt the question to the experiencer: What is time? What sensations are you experiencing? Our aim is to investigate, through sensory illusions, whether synchronization can facilitate a return to the most direct bodily perception of time.

計時工具的演進之下，人對於時間單位的分割越來越細緻與精準，從最早的機械水鐘到現在的原子鐘都在追求更精準的時間，然而越趨精準的量化時間卻與我們對時間最直接的身體經驗有所不同，進而對身體時間的流逝變得無感。Organic-sync創作計畫透過沉浸式體驗結合自製的滴水裝置，製造出視覺、聽覺與觸覺從異步到同步的體驗，交疊多重感官以增幅時間與身體感受的誤差，期望在失感的時代中找回屬於人微幅的脈動。

展覽：2024 法國 LAVAL VIRTUAL RECTO VRso VR類展
特別感謝：虛擬藝術暨聲像遊玩實驗室

人們對光的嚮往，造就了無數對月光的崇拜與傳說。然而，有光即有影。對月亮的憧憬與恐懼，細語如一條條充滿禁忌的警告，流傳並知曉至今。本作品,欲透過裝置的擺設,再現民間傳說的神秘色彩與禁忌故事。邀請各位隨著冒犯的手指們，一同走進傳說的遐想。

互動網頁

現場將擺設QRcode, 邀請觀眾連網至POPMOON。

我們設計的網頁遊戲 POPMOON,如同先前爆紅的網頁遊戲 POPCAT,觀眾僅需不斷的點擊月亮,讓現場的手指受到月亮的懲罰,造成燈光不斷的閃滅。

若當下無觀眾連網至 POPMOON 來冒犯月亮,手部燈具將不再閃爍,進入常設的亮燈模式,進行週期性的亮暗緩慢閃爍。

entry.title: Leashing the Socket
entry.content:
Sockets are all around us in our daily lives, forming a network of electricity that outlines the boundaries of human existence and distinguishes the activities of "modern people." This relationship between humans and sockets creates an unseen force that attaches and restricts us.

Action

We tries to swap the roles of supply and demand between sockets and mobile phones. By having the mobile phone supply power to the socket, it comes alive and starts moving around. The connection through the power cord ties humans and sockets together, resulting in a humorous scenario of "Leash- ing pets." This also invites the audience to ponder: Who leashes whom? Who truly holds the power?

After reversing this dynamic, the intention is to reveal the intricate network formed by humans and non-human elements. The aim is to magnify and liberate it, allowing it to exist as an inde- pendent entity. This introduces the act of "walk- ing" into the relationship between sockets and people, underscoring the unequal state between them. As we walk and follow each other, we continually break free from the confines of the current network, striving to build autonomous individuals.

Next?

By flipping the relationship between subject and object, will the resources inherently possessed by humans be set free?After we stole the power of the audience's mobile phone, we stored the remaining power. These batteries, powered by the audience, will go to the next place....

entry.title: 浮點數｜Float
entry.summary: 現實世界中的行為與物件正不斷轉換成為大量的「資訊」，當人們試圖尋 找能證明「資訊」存在的方法時，也開始嘗試以科學方法計算出「資訊重 量」。然而，成為資訊態的微小物質重量，終究與現實中人們所感受到物…
entry.content:
現實世界中的行為與物件正不斷轉換成為大量的「資訊」，當人們試圖尋 找能證明「資訊」存在的方法時，也開始嘗試以科學方法計算出「資訊重 量」。然而，成為資訊態的微小物質重量，終究與現實中人們所感受到物 體的有著極大差異。我們進一步去思考:數位技術在壓縮、消除人們印象 中的實體之際，世界存在的重量也正快速被濃縮、損耗、蒸散，而我們卻 毫無覺察。

In the real world, actions and objects are continuously being transformed into information. As people attempt to find ways to prove the existence of information, they also start to explore the calculation of its "weight" using scientific methods. However, the weight of tiny particles in their informational state differs greatly from the perceived weight of physical objects in reality. This prompts us to consider further:
as digital technology compresses and erases our impression of physicality, the weight of existence in the world is rapidly condensed, depleted, and dissipated, all
while we remain unaware.

「浮點數」試圖探究在數位技術中經過層層轉換被蒸散掉的重量究竟 為何?作品蒐集關於「I lost ......(我失去......)」的訊息，關注每一個物質 性的消逝。每一次單位裝置的運行，即代表著一條資訊訊息的產製、傳遞 與消散。在數位化過程中遺失重量後，僅存的微小重量藉由裝置將其蒸散 於場域之中，試圖找回人們對於「失去」的身體感受。

"Float" seeks to explore the weight that dissipates through successive transformations within digital technology. The artwork collects messages about "I lost..." and focuses on the materialistic disappearance of each instance. The operation of each unit device represents the generation, transmission, and dissipation of an information message. After losing weight in the process of digitization, the remaining minuscule weight is vaporized into the field through the devices, aiming to recover people's bodily perception of "loss".
